TaiwanCalendar(android.icu.util.TimeZone.Description: Constructs a TaiwanCalendar based on the current time in the given time zone with the given locale.

Parameters: int: The value used to set the calendar's @B_android#icu#util#Calendar#YEAR_E@ time field.
int: The value used to set the calendar's @B_android#icu#util#Calendar#MONTH_E@ time field. The value is 0-based. e.g., 0 for January.
int: The value used to set the calendar's @B_android#icu#util#Calendar#DATE_E@ time field.
TaiwanCalendar(int,int,int).Description: Constructs a TaiwanCalendar with the given date set in the default time zone with the default locale.
TaiwanCalendar(int,int,int).FullName: public TaiwanCalendar (int year, int month, int date)

Parameters: int: one of the above field numbers
int: one of MINIMUM, GREATEST_MINIMUM, LEAST_MAXIMUM, or MAXIMUM
handleGetLimit(int, int).Description: Override GregorianCalendar. There is only one Taiwan ERA. We should really handle YEAR, YEAR_WOY, and EXTENDED_YEAR here too to implement the 1..5000000 range, but it's not critical.
handleGetLimit(int, int).FullName: protected int handleGetLimit (int field, int limitType)

TaiwanCalendar(android.icu.util.ULocale).Description: Constructs a TaiwanCalendar based on the current time in the default time zone with the given locale.

handleGetExtendedYear().Description: Returns the extended year defined by the current fields. This will use the EXTENDED_YEAR field or the YEAR and supra-year fields (such as ERA) specific to the calendar system, depending on which set of fields is newer.

ClassDesc: TaiwanCalendar is a subclass of GregorianCalendar that numbers years since 1912. The Taiwan calendar is identical to the Gregorian calendar in all respects except for the year and era. Years are numbered since 1912 AD (Gregorian). The Taiwan Calendar has one era: MINGUO. This class should not be subclassed. TaiwanCalendar usually should be instantiated using @B_android#icu#util#Calendar#getInstance_E@ passing in a ULocale with the tag "@calendar=roc".
